overview: Summary The privately held Rosemont Group was founded by the businessman and investment entrepreneur Frederick Achom. Achom, born in Nigeria and educated in the United Kingdom, established the Rosemont Group is 2003. He is the group’s chairman and CEO. The Rosemont Group deals in luxury services and goods, and is now worth in the excess of Â£60 million. The group’s main business ventures are UK land and property development, overseas investments and consulting and global supply of luxury items. Frederick Achom is also the major shareholder of the Bordeaux Wine Company, a London-based independent wine merchant that deals with an extensive range of wine merchants operating in the UK and Europe. Rosemont Group The Rosemont Group of Companies has operations in three continents and is based in The Virgin Islands. The Rosemont Group has grown rapidly since its inception, and it now owns a fair share of the consumer goods market with such ventures and investments as high-end restaurants, property development, Italian made kitchens, members-only clubs, an Australian wine merchant and companies in the African services and telecom industries. Accolades Frederick Achom was selected to the exclusive United Kingdom Black Power List of 2011 and 2012. These lists commend the top 100 black men and women who have been the most successful and influential in various fields, from business all the way to politics. The UK Black Power List is made up by the international investment securities and banking firm JP Morgan. Frederick Achom was named as one of the most influential Londoners in 2010 and 2011. This list was compiled by The Evening Standard, and it names the pioneers of London, be it in culture, nightlife, politics or other areas.
